status: MARC21-007: Medium for sound of projected media
Specific medium used to carry the sound of an item (whether the sound is on the projected graphic or separate) and the type of sound playback required for the item.

preferred label (en): optical sound track on motion picture film
definition (en): Sound to accompany a projected graphic is carried on an optical track that is part of a film.
scope note (en): For 16 and 35 mm. films, it is usually assumed that sound is carried on an optical track.

preferred label (en): magnetic sound track on motion picture film
definition (en): Sound to accompany a projected graphic is carried on a magnetic track that is part of the film.
scope note (en): 70 mm. motion picture films often include magnetic sound tracks.

definition (en): Sound to accompany an item is carried on a magnetic audio tape cartridge.
Sound to accompany an item is carried on a sound disc.
scope note (en): This method of providing for sound is typically used with filmstrips. Sound discs include 7, 10, and 12 in. vinyl phonograph records and 4 3/4 in. compact discs.

definition (en): Sound to accompany an item is carried on a reel of magnetic audio tape.
Sound to accompany an item is carried on a cassette of magnetic audio tape.

preferred label (en): optical and magnetic sound track on motion picture film
definition (en): Sound to accompany a projected graphic is carried on both an optical and magnetic track.
Sound to accompany an item is included as part of a videotape.
scope note (en): Videotape is not ordinarily used to record only sound.

definition (en): Sound to accompany an item is included as part of a videodisc.
scope note (en): Videodiscs are not ordinarily used to record only sound. A distinction must be made between videodiscs (e.g., 12 in. laser-scan videodiscs that include video information) and compact discs that are used to record sound only (e.g., 4 3/4 in. audio compact discs). The technology to physically record video or audio information on digital disc systems is the same.

definition (en): Medium for sound is not known.

Medium for sound other than no sound (silent), optical sound track on motion picture film, magnetic sound track on motion picture film, magnetic audio tape in cartridge, sound disc, magnetic audio tape on reel, magnetic audio tape in cassette, optical and magnetic sound track onvideotape, videodisc.
